title: NACC Uniform Data Set (UDS) - INITIAL VISIT PACKETFORM A1V3: SUBJECT DEMOGRAPHICS
description: INSTRUCTIONS: This form is to be completed by intake interviewer based on ADC scheduling records,subject interview, medical records, and proxy co-participant report (as needed),For additional clarification and examples, see UDS Coding Guidebook for Initial Visit Packet.Form A1. Check only one box per question.
comment: Schema for submitting UDS_ivp_A1V3 form information.

reason.title: 1. Primary reason for coming to ADC:
enum: 1 To participate in a research study
4 Both (to participate in a research study and to have a clinical evaluation)

refersc.title: 2a. Principal referral source:
refersc.description: (if answer is 1 or 2, CONTINUE TO QUESTION 2B; otherwise, SKIP TO QUESTION 3.)
enum: 2 Non-professional contact (spouse/partner, relative, friend, coworker, etc.)
4 ADC clinician, staff, or investigator referral
5 Nurse, doctor, or other health care provider
6 Other research study clinician/staff/investigator (non-ADC; e.g., ADNI, Women's Health Initiative)

learned.title: 2b.  If the referral source was self-referral or a non-professional contact, how did the referral source learn of the ADC?
enum: 1 ADC advertisement (e.g., website, mailing, newspaper ad, community presentation)
2 News article or TV program mentioning the ADC study
3 Conference or community event (e.g., community memory walk)
4 Another organization's media appeal or website (e.g., Alzheimer's Association, clinicaltrials.gov)

source.title: 5. ADC enrollment type:
enum: 1 Primarily ADC-funded (Clinical Core, Satellite Core, or other ADC Core or project)
2 Subject is supported primarily by a non-ADC study (e.g., RO1, including non-ADC grants supporting the FTLD Module participation)

birthmo.title: 6a. Subject's month of birth(MM)
birthmo.description: Date can be submitted as MM.

birthyr.title: 6b. Subject's year of birth(YYYY)
birthyr.description: Date can be submitted as YYYY.

hispanic.title: 8. Does the subject report being of Hispanic/Latino ethnicity (i.e. having origins from a mainly Spanish-speaking Latin American country), regardless of race?

hispor.title: 8a. If yes, what are the subject's reported origins?

hisporx.title: 8a1. Other (specify subjects reported origins):
hisporx.description: (Any text or numbers with the exception of single quotes ('), double quotes ("), ampersands (&), and percentage signs (%).)

race.title: 9. What does subject report as his or her race?
enum: 4 Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander

racex.title: 9a. Other (specify subjects race):
racex.description: (Any text or numbers with the exception of single quotes ('), double quotes ("), ampersands (&), and percentage signs (%).)

racesec.title: 10. What additional race does subject report?
enum: 4 Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander

racesecx.title: 10a. Other (specify subject's additional race):
racesecx.description: (Any text or numbers with the exception of single quotes ('), double quotes ("), ampersands (&), and percentage signs (%).)

raceter.title: 11. What additional race, beyond what was indicated above in questions 9 and 10, does subject report?
enum: 4 Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander

raceterx.title: 11a. Other (specify subject's additonal race beyond questions 9 and 10):
raceterx.description: (Any text or numbers with the exception of single quotes ('), double quotes ("), ampersands (&), and percentage signs (%).)

primlanx.title: 12a. Other (specify subject's primary language):
primlanx.description: (Any text or numbers with the exception of single quotes ('), double quotes ("), ampersands (&), and percentage signs (%).)

educ.title: 13. Subject's years of education-(Use the codes here to report the level achieved; if an attempted level is not completed, enter the number of years completed.)
educ.description: 12 = High school or GED,16 = Bachelor's degree,18 = Master's degree,20 = Doctorate,99 = Unknown

educ_type.title: Type of degrees
educ_type.description:
Examples:
DDS
DMD
DO
DPM - podiatrist
DVM - veterinarian
Ed.D.
JD - lawyer
MBA 
MD
MPH
MS
OD
PharmD
PhD
PsyD
SciD

livsitua.title: 15. What is the subject's living situation?
enum: 2 Lives with one other person: a spouse or partner
3 Lives with one other person: a relative, friend, or roommate
4 Lives with caregiver who is not spouse/partner, relative, or friend
5 Lives with a group (related or not related) in a private residence
6 Lives in group home (e.g., assisted living, nursing home, convent)

independ.title: 16. What is the subject's level of independence?
enum: 2 Requires some assistance with complex activities
3 Requires some assistance with basic activities

residenc.title: 17. What is the subject's primary type of residence?
enum: 1 Single - or multi-family private residence (apartment, condo, house)
2 Retirement community or independent group living
3 Assisted living, adult family home, or boarding home
4 Skilled nursing facility, nursing home, hospital, or hospice

zip.title: 18. ZIP Code (first three digits) of subject's primary residence:
zip.description: (ZIP Code can be blank if unknown, in the range 006-999)

handed.title: 19. Is the subject left- or right- handed (for example, which hand would s/he normally use to write or throw a ball)?
